She faintly sank to the floor, raising her hands to her head. In one hand, she still held 'the pledge.' Then he hit her again and again on the same spot with the blunt side. Blood poured out like from a tipped glass, and her body fell back. He stepped back, let it fall, and bent over her face; she was dead. Her eyes looked like they were popping out, and her whole face was twisted and drawn.

He put the axe down near the dead body and quickly checked her pocket, trying to avoid the blood. He was clear-headed and not confused, but his hands were still shaking. He remembered being careful the whole time to not get blood on himself. He pulled out the keys, which were all on a steel ring like before. He ran into the bedroom with them. 

The room was very small and had a lot of holy images. There was a big, clean bed covered with a silk quilt on one wall, and a chest of drawers on another. As soon as he started fitting the keys into the chest and heard them jingle, he felt a sudden shudder. He briefly thought about giving up and leaving, but it was too late to turn back. He even smiled at himself when a frightening thought hit him: what if the old woman was still alive and could wake up?

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov brutally murders the old woman with an axe, confirming her death before searching her belongings.
